snippet: The Blackhawks and the Bruins were exhausted after Game 1 of the finals, but Chicago’s Patrick Kane said his team would have an easier recovery because it was victorious.
abstract: Game 1 of Stanley Cup finals proves to be physically demanding and mentally exhausting battle of attrition for both Chicago Blackhawks and Boston Bruins; Chicago's Patrick Kane predicts his team would have easier recovery because they won, but Bruins are hardly distraught, citing their rebounds from past brushes with adversity in playoffs and finals.

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and BEN STRAUSS

lead_paragraph: The Blackhawks and the Bruins were exhausted after Game 1 of the finals, but Chicago’s Patrick Kane said his team would have an easier recovery because it was victorious.

headline.main: Bruins’ Task After Triple-Overtime Defeat: Restore Focus and Fluids
headline.print_headline: Bruins’ Task After Triple-Overtime Defeat: Restore Focus and Fluids
